result.execSummary:
The defendant Shantella L. Bell was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Shantella L. Bell is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Shantella L. Bell was found guilty of 2nd-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees. 
++  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.            ++  Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.
** Pay extradition fees.   If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered. 
May Not have contact with Candace or George M, Kenyatta M - will only be allowed by Domestic Relations Court.  DOC shall promptly notify the court, in writing, of any new arrest or criminal charge made against the deft.

timeConds.notes: TO COMMENCE FORTHWITH. Huber allowed.  Not to exceed 60 hrs/wk (employment & child care)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Shantella L. Bell

Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge
Extradition in the amount of $143.83

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Burgoyne appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty Aileen Henry.  Victim rights compliance.  Sentencing arguments made.  Sentence w/held; placed on probation for 4yrs.  See conditions.  Deft stipulates to extradition costs of $143.83 - to be paid during probation.  Deft given conditional jail time - to commence forthwith.  Deft taken into custody.  Huber is allowed for work & childcare - not to exceed 60hrs/week.  DNA ordered.  Appeal rights.  Firearm warning.  Voting acknowledgment.  If revoked, deft requests credit for 2 days.
Sentencing hearing on July 14, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
for Pre-Sentence Investigation
Amended

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Kraus appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty Aileen Henry.  Victim rights compliance.  Parties advise the court that the deft wishes to accept the plea offer.  Brief discussion held.  Court will accept the resolution at this time.  Amended information filed.  Deft pleads guilty to count 1; found guilty by the Court.  Remaining counts are dismissed on State's motion.  PSI ordered.  Sentencing set for 6/28/16 @ 10:30am.  Jurors summoned into the courtroom at 9:35am; jurors informed the case is now settled.  Jurors released @ 9:41am - instructed to call the jury phone tonight.
Juror Selection & Peremptory Challenges

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Kraus appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty Aileen Henry.  Voir dire commences @ 10:05am.  Jury selected @ 11am.  Unselected jurors released for the day @ 11:02am.  Brief instructions given to the jury.  Selected jurors released for the day @ 11:13am; instructed to return @ 9am on 4/26/16.

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Kraus appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty Aileen Henry.  Defense ready to proceed; State missing a P.O. witness due to medical issues.  State requests an adjournment; no objection by defense.  For the reasons set forth on the record, the Court grants the State's adjournment request.  JS adj to 4/25/16 @ 9am
